quiz.title: Economics: Macro vs. Micro, Markets, and Excess Demand

questions.question: Which of the following is not part of Macroeconomics?
questions.explanation: Monopoly is a microeconomic topic—it deals with individual market structures. Macroeconomics studies economy-wide aggregates.

questions.question: Excess demand occurs when:
questions.explanation: Excess demand means quantity demanded is greater than quantity supplied at the current price (a shortage).

questions.question: A perfectly competitive market has:
questions.explanation: Perfect competition is characterized by many buyers and many sellers, so no single participant can influence the market price.

questions.question: Microeconomics doesn’t deal with:
options: The study of individual economic units
questions.explanation: General equilibrium analysis studies how all markets in an economy interact and reach simultaneous equilibrium. Though sometimes considered part of microeconomic theory, it is broader and often treated separately; but given options, the others are clearly micro topics while general equilibrium is a more advanced integration of micro and macro ideas. Standard intro courses often exclude it from basic microeconomics.
